title: Roasted Tomato
steps: Slice the tops and bottoms off of the tomato, then slice the tomato in half lengthwise (so that you have two round, fat disks of tomato).
Place the tomato on a baking sheet, season with salt, pepper, and drizzle with olive oil.
Roast the tomatoes until they are plush, withered, and have shrunk in size, around 2-3 hours.
notes: This method is blatantly stolen from the legendary Ivan Orkin, who used this topping to great effect in his shio ramen in Japan.
It's delicious, and a great alternative for an umami-laden ingredient.
Roma tomatoes are recommended, but any tomato you like will work.
The slow roasting concentrates the tomato flavor and creates a sweet, umami-rich topping.
Great for adding complexity to lighter ramen styles, particularly shio ramen.
